SYSTEM: Master_I_AI_Terminology_in_ontologies_07-10-2010%283%29.pdf: Página 25
25
Water in different concept systems
• molecule-composed compound of two atoms of hydrogen 
and one atom of oxygen (H2O), considered the universal 
solvent
• fluid which is colourless, odourless and tasteless used as 
the standard of specific gravity and of specific heat which 
freezes at 0 °C and boils at 100 °C
• chemical compound which is colourless, odourless, and 
tasteless and whose formula is H2O and which is 
naturally found in solid state at temperatures at and below 
0 °C, in liquid state at temperatures between 0 °C and 100 
°C, and as vapour at temperatures above 100 °C
• chemical substance that is essential to all known forms of 
life
• chemical compound whose freezing and boiling points 
are the basis for the Celsius temperature scale, where 
freezing point equals 0 °C and boiling point equals 100 
°C at standard atmospheric pressure
• one of the four elements of life that is associated with the 
emotional and intuitive processes
Chemistry
Physics
Physics
Biology
Metrology
Astrology
speaker: SYSTEM
